name: dui
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] abbreviation for driving under the influence: the crime of operating a motor vehicle while being affected by alcohol or other drugs: He was arrested the next day for DUI. He explained that DUI incidents involve not only alcohol and illegal drugs but also medication. Compare
DWI
[ C ] a conviction (= an occasion when someone is found guilty) for the crime of operating a motor vehicle while being affected by alcohol or other drugs: In the past I have worked for bosses who have had DUIs. This was his third DUI in five years.
More examplesFewer examplesThe breathalyzer was negative, but it was obvious that the driver was on something, and he was booked on suspicion of DUI.His record includes drug convictions and DUI.The penalties for a DUI conviction are getting stricter.He said that a lot of the people they pull over have previous DUIs.
